settings.heading: Clean, Compliant PPE for
settings.sub_heading: Protect your workforce and your product line with certified, food-safe PPE built for hygiene, safety, and operational efficiency—from slaughter lines to packaging rooms and cold storage areas.

settings.description1:
U.S. Food Processing Industry Overview

With over 35,000 active facilities and employing more than 1.7 million workers, the U.S. food processing sector is one of the largest and most tightly regulated industries in the country. From meatpacking and dairy plants to baked goods, snacks, frozen meals, and beverages, this sector fuels both domestic supply chains and international exports.

But behind the scenes, food processing facilities face intense scrutiny. The risks of biological contamination, chemical exposure, equipment-related injuries, and extreme temperature work zones require well-designed safety protocols and high-performing PPE.
settings.description2:
According to OSHA and FDA reports:

  • Non-compliance with PPE in food handling leads to frequent FDA 483 citations and recalls
  • Over 70% of contamination events are traced to improper or inconsistent glove usage
  • Slips, cuts, and repetitive motion injuries are among the top 3 injury types

Maintaining food safety, worker protection, and regulatory compliance starts with investing in the right PPE solutions.

settings.heading: Cuts from slicers, grinders, and bladed tools
Slips in wet or refrigerated areas
Cold exposure in freezers or refrigerated assembly lines
Cross-contamination between allergen and non-allergen lines
Chemical burns during sanitation or equipment cleaning
Low-visibility environments and shaft lighting failure
The Critical Role of PPE | in Food Processing Safety
settings.sub_heading:
In food facilities, PPE serves a dual role: 

1.Protecting workers from workplace hazards (chemicals, cold storage, sharp tools)
2.Preventing contamination of food products through personal contact or particles 

From processing raw meats to packaging dry goods, the right gloves, aprons, sleeves, and footwear help uphold sanitary standards while reducing liability and injury risk.

settings.custom_description: Nitrile, vinyl, cut-resistant, and disposable glove options

settings.heading:
Built for Harsh Climates

From Nevada’s high heat to Alaska’s underground chills, we offer waterproof, insulated, and ventilated PPE options designed to help workers stay focused and safe.

Reinforced for Abrasive, Heavy-Duty Use

We understand mining sites eat gear fast. That’s why our PPE features extra-durable seams, triple-reinforced gloves, and shock-absorbing materials tested in real mine conditions.

Custom Kits for Specific Zones

We create zone-specific PPE kits for shaft work, surface blasting, material handling, and emergency response teams—ensuring the right protection for every job and role.

Protection from Respiratory & Auditory Illnesses

Our NIOSH-certified respirators and high-decibel-rated hearing protection reduce the risk of long-term disability and meet MSHA health guidelines.

settings.question: Is your PPE compliant with USDA and FDA food safety regulations?
settings.answer: Yes. All gloves, garments, and footwear comply with FDA Title 21 and are designed for food contact. Our aprons, sleeves, and gloves are latex-free and USDA-accepted for facilities under federal inspection.

settings.question: Can I order color-coded PPE to minimize cross-contamination risks?
settings.answer: Absolutely. We offer gloves, aprons, sleeves, and helmets in multiple colors to help you separate raw, cooked, allergen, sanitation, and inspection zones—supporting HACCP and GMP protocols.

settings.question: What PPE do I need for cold storage or refrigerated environments?
settings.answer: We provide insulated gear rated to -40°F, including waterproof thermal boots, full-body suits, and anti-fog face shields that resist condensation.

settings.question: Are your gloves and garments approved for direct food contact?
settings.answer: Yes. All disposable gloves and protective garments are manufactured with materials suitable for direct food contact, and we provide compliance documentation upon request.

settings.question: Can I outfit production teams working with meat, dairy, or high-moisture environments?
settings.answer: Yes. We carry waterproof, quick-dry gear with anti-slip soles, moisture-wicking liners, and sanitation-safe aprons that resist fats and acids found in protein and dairy lines.

settings.question: How can I train my team on proper PPE usage to meet audit requirements?
settings.answer: We offer multilingual safety posters, visual zoning charts, and video training modules aligned with SQF, BRC, and GFSI requirements.

settings.question: Do you provide PPE for sanitation crews and chemical handling?
settings.answer: Yes. We stock chemical splash suits, nitrile gloves, goggles, and face shields tested for common sanitation chemicals like peracetic acid, quaternary ammonium, and chlorine-based products.

settings.question: How quickly can you fulfill large orders or restock essential items?
settings.answer: We maintain U.S.-based inventory of high-demand items with 48-hour dispatch options for facilities facing seasonal surges, product recalls, or audits.

settings.question: Can you help me create a PPE matrix for different production zones?
settings.answer: Yes. We can assist with a full facility walkthrough or consultation, and then provide a PPE-by-zone recommendation for raw processing, cooking, packaging, sanitation, QA, and cold storage areas.

settings.question: Do you offer PPE bundles or starter kits for new hires?
settings.answer: We provide convenient PPE starter kits tailored for onboarding that include gloves, apron, cap, beard net, boot covers, and eyewear—available in bulk and ready to deploy shift-by-shift.

settings.heading: Frequently Asked Questions About PPE for Food Processing Facilities
Safety, Hygiene, and Compliance —Delivered Together
settings.description: The success of a food processing facility depends on product integrity, worker protection, and audit readiness. With GE PPE, you don’t have to choose. From meat processing to ready-to-eat packaging, we offer hygienic, task-specific PPE that keeps your team safe and your brand protected.
